modules.title: Causative Vaka-
modules.summary: The causative vaka- introduces an external actor who causes the action or state described by the verb root. It changes intransitive verbs to transitive.

examples.notes: vaka- added to the stative verb levu 'big' makes it transitive and causative - 'make big'
vaka- added to the stative mate 'dead' makes it transitive and causative - 'cause to die, kill'
vaka- added to the intransitive davo 'lie' makes it transitive and causative - 'cause to lie down'

modules.title: Frequentative/Distributive/Intensive Vaka-
modules.summary: With active verbs, vaka- modifies the action to indicate repetition, distribution over objects, or intensity.

examples.english: He searched for it (repeatedly or more thoroughly)
examples.notes: vaka- adds a frequentative/intensive sense to the active verb rai-c-a 'see/look at'
The reduplicated vaka-gunugunu from gunu 'drink' indicates repeated/distributed action
vaka- adds an intensive sense to the active verb dike-v-a 'inspect/scrutinize'

modules.title: Manner/Frequency/Duration Vaka-
modules.summary: With stative verbs and nouns, vaka- indicates manner, frequency or duration of the state or action.

examples.notes: vaka-Viti modifies vosa 'language' to indicate the Fijian manner/style

examples.english: She comes from time to time
examples.notes: vaka-gauna modifies the verb lako 'go/come' to indicate frequency

examples.english: She's happy from time to time
examples.notes: vaka-gauna modifies the stative marau 'happy' to indicate intermittent duration
